alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Geary; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 10:57PM CDT until July 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Dickinson County in central Kansas... Southeastern Geary County in east central Kansas... Morris County in east central Kansas... Southern Wabaunsee County in east central Kansas... Osage County in east central Kansas... Northern Lyon County in east central Kansas... * Until midnight CDT. * At 1057 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Alma to 5 miles northeast of Council Grove Lake to near Burdick, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Emporia, Osage City, Herington, Council Grove, Carbondale, Eskridge, Overbrook, Lyndon, Burlingame, Americus, Scranton, White City, Alta Vista, Hope, Dwight, Harveyville, Reading, Allen, Woodbine and Admire. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 near mile marker 129, and between mile markers 138 and 143. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 128 and 165. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Dickinson; Geary; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Wabaunsee
